Position: National Manager- Health Programs
Functional Area: Programme
Location: New Delhi
Experience: 10-12 Years
Reporting: General Manager – Health & Disaster Response
Reportees: Core Health Program Team

About Smile Foundation:

Smile Foundation works for the welfare of underprivileged children and their families through intensive programmes focused on education, healthcare, skilling and women empowerment and Empowering Grassroots. Started in 2002 by a group of young corporate professionals, today Smile has evolved into a national level development organization impacting lives of over 1.5 million underprivileged children and their families with project presence in 25 states across India, 10 offices in strategic locations and over 650 employees, besides countless volunteers, well-wishers and supporters.

The organization also holds Special Consultative Status with United Nation’s Economic & Social Council (ECOSOC), accredited with global organizations like GuideStar, United Way, CAF America, Give2Asia and many more. Furthermore, continuously for past three years Smile is a Great Place to Work © Certified organization and is considered ‘Gold Standard’ in identifying and recognizing Great Workplace Cultures.

Currently SF has been implementing projects worth Rs 80 Crore across India directly or with the help of grassroot organizations, primarily CSR funded projects of varied scale both in urban slums and rural areas including aspirational districts in thematic areas mentioned above. The wealth of knowledge emanated from the same is immense, however the same is grouped in systematic manner which can be used for pitching for large projects of long term in nature leading to data driven knowledge products which can be further used in creating large scale impact.

Visit our website to know more about us and our latest development: www.smilefoundationindia.org

Summary of Role

As the National Manager of Health Programs, you will play a pivotal role in driving the rapid expansion of healthcare initiatives aimed at delivering doorstep primary healthcare services to millions of low-income adults and children in India through approximately 100 mobile medical units. These programs are a central focus within our organization, demanding a proactive and dynamic approach.

In this capacity, you will be responsible for overseeing the operations of around 100 Mobile Medical Units, Mobile Dental Units, Mobile Telemedicine Units, and Static Clinics, all supported by leading donors and funders. Your success in this role hinges on your in-depth subject matter knowledge, expertise, and hands-on experience in managing operations of this nature. You will directly lead a team of experienced team leads and hold the key responsibility for program implementation and expansion through their efforts.

Key Responsibilities

Program Management

  • Ensure the timely implementation of all approved projects.
  • Oversee the effective implementation of an online Management Information System (MIS) across all projects.
  • Support the program head in program design, delivery, and reporting frameworks.
  • Implement Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to facilitate access to primary healthcare.
  • Track and manage program Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
  • Ensure the timely submission of program and financial reports both within the organization and to donors/funders.
  • Maintain adequate inventory, equipment, consumables, Information, Education, and Communication (IEC) materials, and collateral at all outreach and program sites.
  • Monitor ongoing projects and perform audits via travelling across PAN India.
  • Manage vehicle maintenance and logistics audits.

Financial Management

  • Consolidate annual plans and budgets for programs and monitor progress against them.
  • Manage fund utilization by regularly reviewing and overseeing program budgets and expenses.
  • Ensure financial resources are used in line with agreed-upon deliverables.
  • Facilitate the timely submission of bills from the field, followed by submission to the finance department for reimbursements.
  • Conduct monthly reconciliations with the finance team.

Stakeholder Engagement

  • Foster liaisons and network with government agencies and authorities.
  • Ensure the involvement of government representatives in ongoing programs.
  • Collaborate closely with like-minded organizations.
  • Secure donor renewals and support donor nurturing activities.

Team Management

  • Lead a skilled team dispersed throughout India, providing mentorship, guidance, and motivation to help them achieve their objectives.
  • Monitor the team’s performance and ensure diligent reporting.
  • Offer supportive supervision to train and develop current team members.
  • Review and manage program staffing and field deployments.
  • Enforce strict adherence to all HR policies and protocols.
  • Manage engagement and communication with all internal and external program stakeholders.
  • Make periodic visits to donors/funders and partners.

Qualification and Experience

  1. Master’s Degree in Public Health / Social Work / Sociology / Psychology/ Bachelors in Dental Surgery.
  2. 10-12 years of experience with at least 5-6 years of experience in healthcare program management, preferably in a non-profit or NGO setting.
  3. Demonstrated success in project planning, financial management, program monitoring, report writing, and identifying and procuring technical assistance.

Competencies

  • Communication: Clearly conveying information and ideas through a variety of media to individuals or groups in a manner that engages the audience and helps them understand and retain the message. Able to give and take during a conversation in a balanced way, listening as well as speaking at appropriate intervals.
  • Decision Making: Identifying and understanding issues, problems, and opportunities; comparing data from different sources to draw conclusions; using effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions; taking action that is consistent with available facts, constraints, and probable consequences.
  • Focus Upon Quality: Accomplishes tasks by considering all of the areas involved, no matter how small; shows concern for all aspects of the job; accurately checks processes and tasks; remains watchful over a period of time.
  • Manages Conflict: Dealing effectively with others in an antagonistic situation; using appropriate interpersonal styles and methods to reduce tension or conflict between two or more people.
  • Planning and organizing: Establishing courses of action for self and others to ensure that work is completed efficiently.
  • Analytical Problem Solving: Analyzes information to understand relationships, patterns, and causes and effects, integrate data, and check facts. This is done with both qualitative and quantitative information, making rational and timely judgments on the basis of the information that is available.
  • Delegating responsibility: Allocating decision-making authority and/or task responsibility to appropriate others to maximize organizational and individual effectiveness.

How to Apply:

Share your CV/Profile with a brief note (cover letter) telling why you find yourself a right fit for the role, with the subject line – DevNet-{Your Name}- <Position Applied> – <Location> at jobs@smilefoundationindia.org

Smile Foundation is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Please Note: Only shortlisted candidates would be contacted by the Human Resources Team
